p: The TSMs calculated to assess the window for buffering between upper temperature tolerance (CTMax) and maximum habitat temperatures significantly differed by species ( F 2,400 = 1157, P < 0.001) and the SFE region where the TSM was calculated ( F 3,400 = 1096, P < 0.001). Both non-native species had larger TSMs (ranging from 6.1 to 14.1°C [Silversides] and 5.3 to 13.3°C [Largemouth Bass]) than native Delta Smelt (ranging from 0.6 to 8.6°C, Tukey, P < 0.05, Table 3).
